summary: Leodis C Matthews was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents provided are payroll and certification reports spanning from October 1977 to November 1978. These reports list Matthews' name, position, and salary information during this period. While the specific role Matthews held within the HSCA is not explicitly stated in the summaries, the consistent appearance of their name across multiple payroll certifications indicates a sustained period of employment with the committee. The documents do not provide specific details about Matthews' direct involvement in the JFK assassination investigation, but their presence on the HSCA payroll suggests they contributed to the committee's work in some capacity.
significance: Leodis C Matthews' significance lies in their employment with the HSCA, the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations. As an employee, they were part of the team investigating the JFK assassination, though the specific nature and impact of their contribution is not detailed in these documents.
